name: Shakshuka
description: Middle Eastern eggs poached in spiced tomato sauce. A breakfast favorite that's hearty and flavorful.

instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in a wide skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and cook for 5 minutes until softened.
Add bell peppers and cook for 5 more minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tomatoes, cumin, paprika and spices. Stir to combine.
Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Make small wells in the sauce and crack eggs into them.
Cover and cook 5-7 minutes until eggs are set to your liking.
Garnish with parsley and serve hot.

tips: Runny yolks are traditional - don't overcook.
Serve with crusty bread for dipping.
Add crumbled feta cheese on top.
Increase red pepper flakes for more heat.
storageInfo: Best served fresh. Can be refrigerated for 1 day.
servingSuggestion: Serve hot with fresh bread or pita.
variations: Add chorizo for a heartier version.
